thread.title: New Hartford's Corasanti, Oneida doubles team in tennis semifinals
thread.title_full: New Hartford's Corasanti, Oneida doubles team in tennis semifinals

author: Anne Delaney
title: New Hartford's Corasanti, Oneida doubles team in tennis semifinals
text: New Hartford's Corasanti, Oneida doubles team in tennis semifinals Oneida doubles team of Jillian Brodock and Brianna Laureti and New Hartford singles player Sarah Corasantil advanced to the semifinals at the Section III state qualifying tournament Tuesday in Syracuse. Comment Follow @@OD_Delaney Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 7:03 PM The Oneida girls tennis doubles team of Jillian Brodock and Brianna Laureti, and New Hartford singles player Sarah Corasanti advanced to the semifinals at the Section III state qualifying tournament Tuesday in Syracuse. Brodock and Laureti, playing No. 1 doubles, and Corasanti, at No. 1 singles, all won first-round and quarterfinal matches at Drumlins Country Club and will appear in semifinal final matches beginning at noon Thursday at Drumlins. Brodock and Laureti play West Genesee's Samantha Heyn and Mikayla Mannara in the semifinals. Corasanti will meet Maggie Bonomo of Fayetteville-Manlius. Corasanti, a sophomore who reached the state tournament in 2014, advanced with 6-0, 6-0 victories in both matches. She defeated Westmoreland's Alyssa Bowers in the first round and Ellen Lyga of Notre Dame in the quarters. Brodock and Laureti ousted New Hartford's Katie Farkouh and Morgan Joyce 6-3, 7-5 in the first round. Brodock and Laureti defeated Jamesville-DeWitt's Jungyun Kim and Maya Pollock 6-4, 4-6, 6-2 in the quarterfinals. Samantha Lusher and Lauren Skibitski, Oneida's other doubles team, was defeated by Auburn's Lauryn Husby and Julia Wagner 6-2, 6-2 in the first round Tuesday. Sauquoit Valley's Isabella Arrigo and Tanya Brutsky also lost in straight sets in the first round 1-6, 3-6 to Cameron and MacKenzie Aiello from Westhill. Baldwinsville singles player Kahlei Reisinger defeated Whitesboro's Tori Pellegrino 6-0, 6-0 in the first round and then eliminated Oneida's Jenna Russ by the same score in the quarterfinals.
